item.title: Emily add a quote by Emily Giffin
item.description: "Maybe that's what it all comes down to. Love, not as a surge of passion, but as a choice to commit to something, someone, no matter what obstacles or temptations stand in the way. And maybe making that choice, again and again, day in and day out, year after year, says more about love than never having a choice to make at all." -- Emily Giffin

item.title: Emily add a quote by Emily Giffin
item.description: "...love is the sum of our choices, the strength of our commitments, the ties that bind us together." -- Emily Giffin

item.title: Emily add a quote by John Grogan
item.description: "A person can learn a lot from a dog, even a loopy one like ours. Marley taught me about living each day with unbridled exuberance and joy, about seizing the moment and following your heart. He taught me to appreciate the simple things-a walk in the woods, a fresh snowfall, a nap in a shaft of winter sunlight. And as he grew old and achy, he taught me about optimism in the face of adversity. Mostly, he taught me about friendship and selflessness and, above all else, unwavering loyalty." -- John Grogan

item.title: Emily add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Emily add a quote by Anne Fadiman
item.description: "The action most worth watching is not at the center of things, but where edges meet." -- Anne Fadiman

item.title: Emily add a quote by Dietrich Bonhoeffer
item.description: "When all is said and done, the life of faith is nothing if not an unending struggle of the spirit with every available weapon against the flesh." -- Dietrich Bonhoeffer

item.title: Emily add a quote by Dietrich Bonhoeffer
item.description: "Jesus himself did not try to convert the two thieves on the cross; he waited until one of them turned to him." -- Dietrich Bonhoeffer

item.title: Emily add a quote by Dietrich Bonhoeffer
item.description: "I discovered later, and I'm still discovering right up to this moment, that is it only by living completely in this world that one learns to have faith. By this-worldliness I mean living unreservedly in life's duties, problems, successes and failures. In so doing we throw ourselves completely into the arms of God, taking seriously, not our own sufferings, but those of God in the world. That, I think, is faith." -- Dietrich Bonhoeffer

item.title: Emily add a quote by Dietrich Bonhoeffer
item.description: "God loves human beings. God loves the world. Not an ideal human, but human beings as they are; not an ideal world, but the real world. What we find repulsive in their opposition to God, what we shrink back from with pain and hostility, namely, real human beings, the real world, this is for God the ground of unfathomable love." -- Dietrich Bonhoeffer

item.title: Emily add a quote by Dietrich Bonhoeffer
item.description: "How would you expect to find community while you intentionally withdraw from it at some point? The disobedient cannot believe; only the obedient believe." -- Dietrich Bonhoeffer

item.title: Emily add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Emily add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Emily add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Emily add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Emily add a quote by Billy Sunday
item.description: "Going to church doesn’t make you a Christian any more than going to a garage makes you an automobile." -- Billy Sunday

item.title: Emily add a quote by Soren Kierkegaard
item.description: "The function of prayer is not to influence God, but rather to change the nature of the one who prays." -- Soren Kierkegaard

item.title: Emily add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "All I have seen teaches me to trust the Creator for all I have not seen." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Emily add a quote by St. Francis of Assisi
item.description: "Preach the Gospel at all times, and when necessary, use words." -- St. Francis of Assisi

item.title: Emily add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The Christian does not think God will love us because we are good, but that God will make us good because He loves us." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Emily add a quote by John Henry Newman
item.description: "I sought to hear the voice of God and climbed the topmost steeple, but God declared: "Go down again - I dwell among the people." -- John Henry Newman

item.title: Emily add a quote by Martin Luther King, Jr.
item.description: "Only in the darkness can you see the stars." -- Martin Luther King, Jr.

item.title: Emily add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "I don't think of all the misery, but of the beauty that still remains." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Emily add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Emily add a quote by Dan Brown
item.description: "Science and religion are not at odds. Science is simply too young to understand." -- Dan Brown

item.title: Emily add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "I can see how it might be possible for a man to look down upon the earth and be an atheist, but I cannot conceive how a man could look up into the heavens and say there is no God." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Emily add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Emily add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is impossible to live without failing at something, unless you live so cautiously that you might as well not have lived at all - in which case, you fail by default." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Emily add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "I don't believe in the kind of magic in my books. But I do believe something very magical can happen when you read a good book." -- J.K. Rowling
